item.title: 为什么中国无法解决房地产市场的混乱局面？
item.description: 中国的房地产市场曾经是中国经济增长的最大动力之一，但五年来，中国的房地产市场一直在螺旋式下滑，没有丝毫减弱的迹象。房地产价值持续暴跌，陷入经济困境的家庭被迫出售房产，在投机项目上背负巨额债务的公寓开发商濒临倒闭。【原文：Once one of the country’s biggest growth drivers, China’s property market has been in a downward spiral for five years with no signs of abating. Real estate values continue to plummet, households in financial distress are being forced to sell properties, and apartment developers that have racked up enormous debt on speculative projects are on the brink of collapse.】

item.title: 特朗普关税前夕亚洲各地工厂活动萎缩
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 4 月 2 日宣布征收全球关税之前，亚洲一些最大的制造业国家 3 月份的活动进一步放缓。【原文：Activity in some of Asia’s largest manufacturing nations slowed further in March ahead of President Donald Trump’s global tariff announcement on April 2.】

item.title: 韩国将于 4 月 4 日对尹炳世总统弹劾案做出裁决
item.description: 韩国即将就被弹劾总统尹锡烈的政治命运作出裁决，决定是否因其短命的戒严令而将其永久免职，还是恢复其职务。【原文：South Korea is poised to rule on the political fate of impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol, deciding whether to permanently remove him from office for his short-lived martial law decree or reinstate him.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普加征关税，中国私营工厂指数仍高于预期
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，中国制造业活动以四个月来最快的速度增长，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）准备进一步提高对美国出口商品关税之际，中国制造业表现出的韧性将经受考验，令人惊讶。【原文：China’s manufacturing activity improved at the fastest pace in four months, according to a private survey, a surprising show of resilience that will be tested as Donald Trump prepares to raise tariffs further on exports into the US.】

item.title: 小野寺说，特朗普关税可能给日本带来经济危机
item.description: 日本执政党的一位资深议员说，特朗普政府的关税可能会给日本带来一场巨大的经济危机，他还说，特别是汽车关税将对日本所有地区产生巨大影响。【原文：The Trump administration’s tariffs may spell a big economic crisis for Japan, a senior lawmaker in Japan’s ruling party said, adding that the auto tariffs in particular would have huge implications across all regions in Japan.】

item.title: 越南旨在通过进口减税抵消特朗普关税
item.description: 越南政府在其网站上发表声明，宣布削减包括液化天然气和汽车在内的一系列产品的进口关税，以抵御美国可能征收的新关税。【原文：Vietnam, in a race to head off possible new US tariffs, announced it slashed import levies on a range of products, including liquefied natural gas and automobiles, according to a statement on the government’s website.】

item.title: 日本创纪录的 1,000 多亿美元债券交易出现裂痕
item.description: 日本一度低迷的信贷市场已发展成为一个地区巨头，一年内交易额超过 1,000 亿美元，但央行转向加息可能开始影响其吸引力。【原文：Japan’s once-sluggish credit market has grown into a regional giant that saw more than $100 billion of deals in a year, but the central bank’s shift to rate hikes may be starting to weigh on its appeal.】

item.title: 新加坡私人住宅价格上涨 0.6%，涨幅意外放缓
item.description: 新加坡私人住宅价格在第一季度的增长速度放缓，出乎分析师的意料。【原文：Singapore private home prices grew at a slower pace in the first quarter, surprising analysts who had expected a bigger rise after months of renewed interest in new projects.】

item.title: 巴菲特的伯克希尔哈撒韦公司委托银行进行日元债券交易
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. is planning to sell yen bonds in the global markets, after the billionaire revealed that the firm is looking to increase ownership in Japan’s five main trading houses.】

item.title: 韩国领导人否决扩大董事会对股东职责的法案
item.description: 韩国代总统否决了一项具有里程碑意义的法案，该法案将加强公司董事会对股东的责任，在企业集团与改革倡导者的争议中站在了企业集团一边。【原文：South Korea’s acting president vetoed a landmark bill that would heighten corporate boards’ accountability to shareholders, siding with conglomerates in their dispute with reform advocates.】

item.title: 澳大利亚内陆一周内遭遇一年降雨量，引发半个世纪以来最严重洪灾
item.description: 澳大利亚昆士兰州西部偏远的内陆地区在一周内遭受了一年降雨量的袭击，洪水泛滥，牲畜被冲走。【原文：Australia’s remote outback in western Queensland has been swamped by flooding after being lashed with a year’s worth of rainfall in a week, sweeping away livestock.】

item.title: 美国加征新关税前韩国出口回升
item.description: 韩国 3 月份的出口增长势头有所回升，这为决策者们提供了一些宽慰，他们正努力保护这个依赖贸易的经济体免受唐纳德-特朗普总统不断升级的关税运动的影响。【原文：South Korea’s exports picked up growth momentum in March, offering some relief for policymakers scrambling to shield the trade-reliant economy from President Donald Trump’s escalating tariff campaign.】

item.title: 日本央行酝酿加息步伐，日本商业景气保持乐观
item.description: 尽管全球贸易前景的不确定性继续增加，但日本大型制造商仍对商业状况保持乐观，支持央行继续以渐进的步伐提高利率。【原文：Japan’s large manufacturers remained upbeat about business conditions, supporting the case for the central bank to keep raising interest rates at a gradual pace even as uncertainties over the prospects for global trade continue to mount.】

item.title: 加拿大加征关税后，中国养鱼户面临更高的食品成本
item.description: 鱼类食品可能会成为全球贸易争夺战中最不起眼的牺牲品之一，扰乱从北美大草原到遍布中国河流、湖泊和三角洲的成千上万个养鱼场的供应链。【原文：Fish food could be one of the more obscure casualties of a world fighting over trade, disrupting a supply chain that runs from the North American prairies to the thousands of fish farms that dot China’s rivers, lakes and deltas.】

item.title: 石油大幅上涨，特朗普制裁和关税成为焦点
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普暗示美国可能会努力减少来自世界第三大原油生产国和主要出口国俄罗斯的原油运输量，原油在周一跳水后回稳。【原文：Oil steadied after jumping on Monday as President Donald Trump suggested that the US may work to curtail crude shipments from Russia, the world’s third-largest producer and a major exporter.】

item.title: 英国食品通胀创九个月新高 工党压力倍增
item.description: 由于英国工党政府在生活费用问题上面临着越来越大的政治压力，橱柜主食和酒精饮料价格的上涨使英国食品通胀率达到了九个月来的最高点。【原文：The rising price of store cupboard staples and alcoholic drinks has lifted UK food inflation to a nine-month high, as the country’s Labour government faces growing political pressure over living costs.】

item.title: 中国国有开发商因扩大土地持有量而反弹
item.description: 随着中国房地产企业在核心城市加大购地力度，市场份额有望得到巩固，在这种预期的支撑下，中国硕果仅存的房地产企业正迎来股价反弹。【原文：China’s last standing property firms are enjoying a stock rebound underpinned by expectations of market share consolidation as they ramp up land purchases in core cities.】

item.title: Hooters 在德克萨斯州申请破产，品牌正在考虑扭亏为盈计划
item.description: Hooters of America 已申请破产，这个以鸡翅和超薄服务员制服著称的休闲餐饮品牌正在努力吸引顾客。【原文：Hooters of America has filed bankruptcy as the casual-dining brand known for its chicken wings and skimpy server uniforms struggles to lure customers.】

item.title: 交易员为关税前的更多波动做好准备：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）即将推出的关税措施继续引发市场担忧，导致周二全球股市再次陷入震荡。【原文：Global stocks were poised to endure another rocky session on Tuesday as concerns around President Donald Trump’s looming tariff rollout continue to whipsaw markets.】

item.title: Trafigura 同意就贿赂丑闻向巴西支付 4900 万美元
item.description: Trafigura 集团去年承认为在巴西赢得业务而行贿，并同意向巴西政府支付 4900 万美元。【原文：Trafigura Group agreed to pay Brazil’s government $49 million after last year admitting to paying bribes to win business in the nation.】

item.title: OpenAI 完成 400 亿美元融资，估值达 3000 亿美元
item.description: ChatGPT背后的人工智能公司OpenAI表示，该公司已经完成了一轮融资，将从软银集团公司和其他投资者那里获得400亿美元的资金，估值为3000亿美元，其中包括筹集到的资金。【原文：OpenAI, the artificial intelligence company behind ChatGPT, said it has finalized a funding round that will bring in $40 billion from SoftBank Group Corp. and other investors at a $300 billion valuation, including money raised.】

item.title: 美国审查中国贸易协定加剧习特会紧张局势
item.description: 在习近平与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）达成第一份贸易协议五年之后，美国官员将对中国政府遵守协议的情况发表看法，而这一周将是高度紧张的一周。【原文：Five years after Xi Jinping struck his first trade deal with Donald Trump, US officials are set to deliver their view of Beijing’s compliance with that bargain, in a high-stakes week likely to fan tensions.】

item.title: Netceed 债权人在潜在债务谈判前求助于 Gibson Dunn
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，电信供应商耐吉德（Netceed）的一批债权人在与该公司进行可能的重组谈判之前，已委托律师事务所 Gibson Dunn & Crutcher 提供咨询意见。【原文：A group of creditors of telecommunications provider Netceed have tapped law firm Gibson Dunn & Crutcher for advice ahead of potential restructuring talks with the company, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国人民银行因关税风险和现金短缺而很快部署刺激政策
item.description: 摩根大通等全球贷款机构预计，中国最快将于4月份推出期待已久的货币刺激政策，而时间安排可能受到美国加征关税和季节性现金短缺的双重威胁。【原文：Global lenders like JPMorgan Chase & Co. expect China to deliver its long-awaited monetary stimulus as soon as in April, with timing likely dictated by the double threat of US tariff hikes and a seasonal cash shortage.】

item.title: 第一量子公司退出巴拿马铜矿仲裁案
item.description: 第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）撤销了针对巴拿马的一起仲裁案件，并暂停了另一起仲裁案件，这表明该公司有可能与巴拿马就已停产一年多的铜矿进行更多谈判。【原文：First Quantum Minerals Ltd. dropped one of its arbitration cases against Panama and suspended another, signaling potential for more negotiations with the nation over the company’s copper mine that’s been shuttered for more than a year.】

item.title: 特朗普成立投资办公室监管芯片法案基金
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统签署了一项行政命令，在商务部内设立一个办公室，以促进和加快在美国超过 10 亿美元的投资，并管理《芯片与科学法案》的联邦基金。【原文：President Donald Trump signed an executive order to establish an office within the Commerce Department to facilitate and speed up investments of more than $1 billion in the US and administer federal funds from the Chips and Science Act.】

item.title: 美国汽车制造商游说将低成本零部件排除在关税之外
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国汽车制造商正在游说特朗普政府将某些汽车零部件排除在关税之外，作为在关税本周生效前影响关税的最后努力的一部分。【原文：US automakers are lobbying the Trump administration to exclude certain vehicle parts from tariffs as part of a last-ditch effort to influence the levies before they start taking effect this week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 富国银行认为特朗普贸易战打响后美元将反弹
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.）的货币策略师称，美元将成为唐纳德-特朗普总统贸易战的市场赢家之一。【原文：Wells Fargo & Co.’s currency strategists say the US dollar stands to be one of the market winners from President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官称优先招聘和留住工程人才
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp.英特尔公司首席执行官陈立武（Lip-Bu Tan）表示，他的首要任务之一是为这家芯片制造商补充一些多年来流失的人才。【原文：Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan said one of his priorities will be to restock the chipmaker with some of the talent that it has lost over the years.】

item.title: Newsmax 创始人、前《纽约邮报》记者克里斯托弗-鲁迪如今已是亿万富翁
item.description: Newsmax Inc. 首次以上市公司身份亮相后，其创始人兼首席执行官克里斯托弗-鲁迪（Christopher Ruddy）的身家暴涨 735%，达到约 33 亿美元。【原文：Newsmax Inc.’s debut as a public company has given founder and Chief Executive Officer Christopher Ruddy a fortune of about $3.3 billion after its shares surged 735%.】
